reference.text: devices or installations peculiar to internal-combustion engines F02P; of cigarettes or tobacco A24F; compositions therefor, chemical igniters C06C

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: lighters containing fuel F23Q2/00; matches C06F

title-part.text: on a part moved by the fuel-controlling member, e.g. by a tap on a gas cooker
Lighters containing fuel, e.g. for cigarettes

CPC-specific-text.text: fuel which is fluid at atmospheric pressure

title-part.text: with ignition by spring action of the cover
with cerium-iron alloy and torch ignited by striking or pushing
Lighters with gaseous fuel, e.g. the gas being stored in liquid phase
with cerium-iron alloy and friction wheel
ignition pills or strips with inflammable parts

reference.text: ignition pills C06C9/00, C06C15/00; corresponding lighters with fluid fuel F23Q2/10

title-part.text: Lighters characterised by electrical ignition of the fuel

reference.text: lighter with electrically-produced sparks but without fuel F23Q3/00
lighters with incandescent ignition but without fuel F23Q7/00

title-part.text: Lighters characterised by catalytic ignition of fuel
Lighters characterised by being combined with other objects

CPC-specific-text.text: combined with clock, timer or counter

title-part.text: with containers for flints or tools
Guides for, or arrangements of, flints
Make-and-break ignition, i.e. with spark generated between electrodes by breaking contact therebetween

reference.text: specially adapted for internal-combustion engines F02P15/00

title-part.text: Igniters using electrically-produced heat, e.g. lighters for cigarettes
with fans for transfer of heat to fuel
for evaporating and igniting liquid fuel, e.g. in hurricane lanterns
for gaseous fuel, e.g. in welding appliances
without interlock with main fuel supply
for upright burners, e.g. gas-cooker burners
for inverted burners, e.g. gas lamps
with interlock with main fuel supply
to determine the sequence of supply of fuel to pilot and main burners
to permit the supply to the main burner in dependence upon existence of pilot flame
using electric means, e.g. by light-sensitive elements
remote from the burner, e.g. on the chimney of a lamp
on a part moved by the fuel controlling member
and moving out of the flame after ignition

CPC-specific-text.text: using light, e.g. sunlight or laser

title-part.text: using gas burners, e.g. gas pokers
using portable burners, e.g. torches, fire pots
Devices for effecting ignition from a remote location
Extinguishing-devices, e.g. for blowing-out or snuffing candle flames
